meanings.definition: Make (someone) aware of a particular issue or situation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will sensitise the students to the importance of recycling.
meanings.sent2: It is important to sensitise the public about the dangers of climate change.
meanings.sent3: The comedian sensitised the audience to the absurdity of everyday life.
meanings.sent4: Her story sensitised me to the struggles of single parents.
meanings.sent5: The documentary sensitised viewers to the harsh realities of poverty.

meanings.definition: Make (something) sensitive or susceptible to a particular stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The new paint will sensitise the metal surface for better adhesion.
meanings.sent2: Certain chemicals can sensitise the skin to sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain sensitised the paper and caused it to tear easily.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise sensitised my ears to even the slightest sound.
meanings.sent5: The training will sensitise the employees to the importance of safety measures.
